byline.contributor: Hari Kumar and Suhasini Raj contributed reporting.

abstract: Intense security surrounding release of India's national spending plan necessitates sequestering of roughly 100 proofreaders and press operators in subterranean bunker for more than a week; elaborate confidentiality, which dates to time of British Raj, is intended to prevent leaks that might give companies unfair economic advantage.
lead_paragraph: An army of workers has been holed up for days in a subterranean space, proofreading and preparing to print 10,000 copies of what many hope will be a momentous and politically risky plan by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

headline.main: India Prepares a Budget, Surrounded by Secrecy and Big Expectations
headline.print_headline: Fueled by Tea in a Budget Lockdown

snippet: An army of workers has been holed up for days in a subterranean space, proofreading and preparing to print 10,000 copies of what many hope will be a momentous and politically risky plan by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
